page.title: 01DESCRIPTION OF MONMOUTH AREA
page.content: The area is regarded as one of outstanding natural beauty with many {tourists}visiting it during the season.It is{predominantly wooded}with a 50/50 mix of deciduous and conifer trees.Much of the area is managed by the Forestry Commission and the rest is mainly grazing suitable for cattle and sheep.Wild deer roam freely in the Forest of Dean.Salmon fishing is still important in this area;the{River Wye runs through the South-West corner.Wyesham is a community on the edge of the market town of Monmouth,separated from the town by the River Wye.Staunton is a growing village. Many people{commute}to the larger town of Cardiff,Newport,Hereford and Gloucester.
